issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Increase width of columns used for general configuration in the metastore.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
This is for oracle only. Does not appear to be an issue with other DBs. When you upgrade hive schema from 2.1.0 to hive 3.0.0, the width of TXN_COMPONENTS.TC_TABLE is 256 and COMPLETED_TXN_COMPONENTS.CTC_TABLE is 128.

But if you install hive 3.0 schema directly, their widths are 128 and 256 respectively. This is consistent with schemas for other databases.
fields.summary: Schema column width inconsistency in Oracle

The test failures do no appear to be related to the fix. I have been able to run a few of them locally and they work fine. [~aihuaxu] Could you please review? Thanks
Thanks [~ychena] Fix has been committed to master for 3.0 release.
[~ngangam] We have already cut branch for 3.0 release so pushing to master won't get this in 3.0 release. If you would like to get this in 3.0 you will need to push this in branch-3.
Thanks [~vgarg] I will push it to branch-3 as well. While it is not super critical, it would be nice to include it given it is really low risk.
Pushed to branch-3 as well for 3.0.0
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
